summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from September 2020 regarding the Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) forwarding its draft report on the 2006-2008 Jeffrey Epstein investigation for a sensitivity review. The emails discuss coordinating the review to ensure it does not impact the FBI's legal position (7A stance) or ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the OPR report concerning the Southern District of Florida's handling of his case during 2006-2008.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Period
events.description: The timeframe of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation handled by the Southern District of Florida, which is the subject of the OPR draft report.

events.title: OPR Report Transmittal
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility transmits its draft report on the Epstein matter to the FBI's Office of General Counsel for a sensitivity review.

events.title: FBI Internal Review Coordination
events.description: Internal FBI emails between the Litigation Support Unit and the New York Field Office coordinating the review of the OPR draft report to assess impact on the FBI's 7A legal position and ongoing investigations.

locations: US Department of Justice, 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed a draft report investigating the Southern District of Florida's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter from 2006-2008.
OPR transmitted the draft report to the FBI's Office of General Counsel in September 2020 for a confidential sensitivity review before publication.
The FBI's Litigation Support Unit and a Special Agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad coordinated the review.

The primary concern for the FBI review was to ensure the report's release would not impact the FBI's '7A stance' (a legal position, likely related to confidentiality or privileges) or any ongoing investigations.
The email chain indicates the review was requested with a short deadline, prompting discussions about a possible extension.
